title: Reflected XSS in Search Functionality via q Parameter
vulnerability_information:
## Summary The search functionality at `/search` is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS). The `q` parameter value is reflected directly into the HTML response without any sanitization or encoding. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Navigate to the target application 2. Go to the search page at `/search` 3. Inject the following payload in the `q` parameter: ``` /search?q= ``` 4. The JavaScript executes in the context of the page, showing an alert box with the domain name ## Proof of Concept ``` GET /search?q= HTTP/1.1 Host: target.com ``` The response body contains: ```html

Search Results for:

``` The script tag is rendered and executed by the browser. ## Impact An attacker can craft a malicious URL and send it to a victim. When the victim clicks the link, arbitrary JavaScript executes in their browser session, allowing: - Session hijacking via cookie theft - Phishing by modifying page content - Keylogging - Redirecting to malicious sites
